channel.title: Tim Engle Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Tim Engle Blog

item.title: First Day at Hacker Dojo
item.description: While on my journey to get my first full time in the tech industry I have decided to move back in with my father who has just retired. He has tons of free time on his hands which he uses to spend time on his hobby of taking care of fish. He has so many fish tanks that I now literally SLEEPING WITH THE FISHES. While it is great to be home and see that my father is enjoying his deserved retirement, his enthusiasm for taking care of the fish can be pretty distracting while I am trying to study for certifications and work on projects. In order to be in a more productive environment for my studies I have decided to join a local co-working space called Hacker Dojo.

item.title: A Simple Guide to Name Resolution
item.description: Network management requires machines to be able to communicate efficiently, and one of the simplest ways to achieve this is via domain names. But how does a machine know where to send traffic for any particular domain name? Without proper name resolution, communication becomes challengingâ€”at best requiring humans to memorize IP addresses, and at worst causing a complete communication failure. By the end of this article, you will know how to configure name resolution on a Linux machine and ensure seamless communication across your network.

item.title: Continuous Deployment: Getting Started with CD for Containerized Go Apps Using GitHub Actions & GCP
item.description:
Introduction to This Series

This post serves as an introduction to this series on creating a CD pipeline for containerized Go apps using GitHub Actions and GCP.

The Goal

Currently this blog is ready to host, but still needs some features that I would like to add in order for it to make it more engaging for user, easier for my to add posts, simpler to update posts, and add the ability to view metrics on posts.
